document.docAuthor: Giroti, André Marsola & Brescovit, Antonio Domingos
document.docTitle: Ariadna comata Giroti & Brescovit, 2018, sp. reval.
document.masterDocTitle: The taxonomy of the American Ariadna Audouin (Araneae: Synspermiata: Segestriidae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: The taxonomy of the American Ariadna Audouin (Araneae: Synspermiata: Segestriidae)

heading.emphasis:
Ariadna comata
O. P.- Cambridge, 1898 sp. reval.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Ariadne comata
O. P.- Cambridge, 1898 : 235, pl. 30, fig. 8 (♀ holotype from Orizaba [18°51'N; 97°06'W], Vera Cruz, Mexico, Godman & Salvin leg., deposited in NHM 1901.3.3.77, examined).—F. O. P.- Cambridge (1899: 32) .— Petrunkevitch (1911: 131) .— Bonnet (1955: 732) .—
Beatty (1970: 461, Syn. with
A. pilifera
)
.
Note. The revalidation of this species is based on the examination of the holotype , and also non-type specimens near the type locality.

Additional material examined. MEXICO :
Puebla State:
Puebla , Villa Juaréz [ 19°03'06.4"N ; 98°13'37.6"W ], 1♀ ,
23.X.1951
(CNAN-Ar 007980)
;
Veracruz State:
San Andrés Tuxtla , Estación de Biología Los Tuxtlas ( 18º35'11.2" N ; 95º04'30.5"W ), 9♀ ,
28‒31.VII.2014
, A.M. Giroti et al. leg. ( IBSP 209944-209952 ); Cueva de Ruiz Cortinez ; entorno;
1067m
( 18º32'39.2" N ; 95º08'36.1"W ), 1♀ ,
28.VII.2014
, A.M. Giroti et al. leg. ( IBSP 209953 )
;
Chiapas State:
3km SE Custepec ;
1740m
; secondary mesophil forest [ 15°42'51,9''N ; 92°56'16,5''W ], 1♂ ,
17.V.2008
(
MCZ 80543
)
.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 29.
Ariadna comata
O. P.-Cambridge, 1898. Male from 3km SE Custepec (MCZ 80543) (A‒E): habitus, dorsal (A) and ventral view (B); left leg I, prolateral (C) and retrolateral view (D), arrowheads = lanceolated macrosetae; left metatarsus I, ventral view (E), arrowhead = blunt macroseta. Female from Estación de Biología “Los Tuxtlas” (IBSP 209953) (F‒I): habitus, dorsal (F) and ventral view (G); right leg I, prolateral (H) and retrolateral view (I). Scale bar: 1mm.

FIGURE 30.
Ariadna comata
O. P.-Cambridge, 1898. Male from 3km SE Custepec (MCZ 80543) (A‒B): left palp, prolateral (A) and retrolateral view (B). Female from Estación de Biología “Los Tuxtlas” (IBSP 209948) (F‒I): internal genitalia, lateral view (C); anterior receptaculum, ventral view (D). Scale bar: 1mm.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Diagnosis.
Ariadna comata
is similar to
A. bicolor
,
A. pilifera
and
A. weaveri
due to the morphology of the male palp ( Figs 13A‒B , 28A‒B , 42A‒B ) and macrosetae pattern of the tibia II of females, but males differ by the presence of metatarsi I with two conspicuous lateral conical apophyses, one on each side, bearing one macrosetae in the base of the retrolateral, and one blunt macroseta (i.e. globous shaft with rounded tip) on the prolateral one ( Fig. 29C‒E ); females differ from
A. bicolor
by the presence of a dorsal lobe shorter than the ventral lobe, from
A. weaveri
by the expanded ventral lobe and smaller glandular ducts plate, and from
A. pilifera
by the ventral lobe longer and more sinuous ( Fig. 30C‒D ).
Variation. Female (n=10): total lenght 6.96‒12.32; carapace 3.2‒5.0 long, 1.96‒3.0 wide; femur I 2.16‒3.65.

Distribution. Southeast and south of
Mexico
( Fig. 67 ).
